parameters.content:
## üìö Thesis & Dissertation Research Assistant

### What this workflow does
1. Watches Google Drive folder for thesis/chapter uploads
2. Downloads and extracts academic content
3. Identifies thesis statement, methodology, framework
4. Searches academic databases for related papers
5. Compiles reading list sorted by citations
6. Logs research summary to Google Sheets
7. Sends Slack notification with findings

### Setup steps
1. Connect Google Drive account (OAuth2)
2. Get PDF Vector API key from pdfvector.com/api-keys
3. Create Google Sheet with columns:
   Title, Chapter, Thesis Statement, Methodology, Framework, Key Concepts, Search Terms, Papers Found, Research Questions, Processed Date
4. Update spreadsheet ID in Google Sheets node
5. Set your thesis folder ID in Google Drive Trigger
6. Connect Slack and set research channel

### Academic databases searched
- Semantic Scholar
- PubMed
- ArXiv

### Perfect for
- PhD students writing dissertations
- Graduate researchers doing lit reviews
- Academic writers finding related work

## üìä Extracted Fields

- Title & Author
- Institution & Degree
- Thesis statement
- Key concepts
- Methodology
- Theoretical framework
- Research questions
- Keywords for search

## üî¨ Academic Sources

- Semantic Scholar
- PubMed (medical)
- ArXiv (preprints)

Returns top 15 papers
sorted by citation count

parameters.prompt: Extract academic content from this thesis or dissertation chapter. Identify: title, author name, institution, degree type (PhD/Masters/etc), chapter or section title, main thesis statement or argument, key concepts and terms, research methodology, theoretical framework, main findings or claims, research questions, and keywords useful for literature search.
